column1: Ibaté is a municipality in the state of São Paulo
column3: 734 in 2010 according to IBGE. The city's name comes from the Tupi language and means "dry lake".Ibaté is located on the east-center of the state
column4: 12 km from São Carlos and 247 km from the city of São Paulo.

column1: The origins and development of the city has relation with the coffee production on the region
column2: at the end of the 19th century. The village of São João Batista da Lagoa was founded on January 29
column3: 1893. In 1900 the village was elevated to district
column4: with the name of Vila de Ibaté

column3: Ibaté was officially established as a municipality.
